item.title: Meta Finalizes $14.3 Billion Scale Investment, Hires Its CEO
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. has finalized a multibillion-dollar investment in Scale AI and recruited the startup’s chief executive officer to join its artificial intelligence efforts — an unusual deal that signals a heightened push by the social media giant to catch up on AI development.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner, Rachel Metz, Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: The Scale AI logo on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Thursday, Aug. 17, 2023. The head of Scale AI, which helps companies like the designer of ChatGPT improve the data that feed their systems, recently said the US risks losing its edge to China in the quality of data used as "ammunition" for the powerful new tools. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: CATL Shares Clouded by Bleak Outlook After Mega Hong Kong Debut
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. has received little love following its splashy $5.2 billion listing in Hong Kong last month, as investors eye multifold challenges in the global EV battery market.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

media:content.media:description: Robin Zeng, founder and chairman of CATL, left, with Paul Chan, Hong Kong's financial secretary, during the company's listing ceremony in Hong Kong on May 20. Photographer: Paul Yeung/Bloomberg

item.title: Nexon Shares Jump 10% as Tencent Said to Study Acquisition

item.title: Tencent Studies Deal for $15 Billion Game Developer Nexon
item.description: Tencent Holdings Ltd. is studying a potential deal for Nexon Co., as the Chinese internet giant looks for ways to bolster its lucrative gaming operations, people with knowledge of the matter said.

item.title: Fintech Chime Climbs 37% in Debut After $864 Million IPO
item.description: Chime Financial Inc. rose 37% in its trading debut after pricing its shares above the marketed range to raise raising $864 million in the year’s sixth-biggest US initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes, Paige Smith, Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: Attendees celebrate during the Chime Financial Inc. initial public offering at the Nasdaq MarketSite in New York, US, on Thursday, June 12, 2025. Chime Financial Inc. shares are indicated to open at $45 each on Thursday, as much as 67% above the initial public offering price of $27 each.

item.title: NRG Expects to Line Up New US Data Center Deals This Quarter
item.description: NRG Energy Inc. is working on deals to power US data centers “all over the country” and will reveal details with second-quarter results, according to the top executive of the independent generator.

media:content.media:description: Larry Coben, chairman and chief executive officer of Tremisis Energy Corp., speaks during the 2024 CERAWeek by S&P Global conference in Houston, Texas, US, on Thursday, March 21, 2024. More than 7,000 people are headed to Houston to attend the conference with a key question in mind: How to meet increasing demand for power amid the transition to clean energy.

item.title: A Fatal Tesla Crash Shows the Limits of Full Self-Driving
item.description: As Elon Musk touts robotaxis in Austin, federal regulators are investigating whether Tesla’s system is dangerous even with a human behind the wheel.

item.title: AMD Says New Chips Can Top Nvidia’s in Booming AI Chip Field
item.description: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. Chief Executive Officer Lisa Su said her company’s latest AI processors can challenge Nvidia Corp. chips in a market she now expects to soar past $500 billion in the next three years.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Lisa Su, chair and chief executive officer of Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD), holds an artificial intelligence processor during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Monday, June 3, 2024. AMD is speeding up introductions of new artificial intelligence processors as it seeks to dent Nvidia Corp.’s domination of that lucrative market.

item.title: Apple Targets Spring 2026 for Release of Delayed Siri AI Upgrade
item.description: Apple Inc. has set an internal release target of spring 2026 for its delayed upgrade of Siri, marking a key step in its artificial intelligence turnaround effort.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Craig Federighi, senior vice president of software engineering at Apple Inc., during the Apple Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) at Apple Park campus in Cupertino, California, US, on Monday, June 9, 2025. Apple Inc. unveiled a new operating system interface called Liquid Glass at its annual Worldwide Developers Conference, calling it the company’s broadest design update ever.

item.title: GameStop’s Future Is in Trading Cards, CEO Says
item.description: GameStop Corp., the largest standalone video-game retailer in the US, will focus on growing its trading card business, Chief Executive Officer Ryan Cohen said at the company’s annual shareholder meeting Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Cecilia D'Anastasio

media:content.media:description: Packs of Pokemon Co. cards in Random Lake, Wisconsin, U.S., on Thursday, July 1, 2021. In 2020 overall trading card sales climbed a record 142% on EBay, and Pokemon led the pack, averaging five card sales a minute—more than even baseball cards. This year, EBay listings of Pokemon cards were up 1,046% in the first quarter.

item.title: Scale AI Picks New CEO as Wang Set to Join Meta After Investment
item.description: Scale AI plans to promote Chief Strategy Officer Jason Droege to serve as its next chief executive officer following a multibillion-dollar investment from Meta Platforms Inc., according to two people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

item.title: US Says Export Controls to Keep Huawei AI Output Limited in 2025
item.description: A senior Trump administration official said that Huawei Technologies Co.’s ability to produce AI semiconductors will be very limited this year, responding to US lawmakers’ concerns that China is gaining ground in production of advanced semiconductors.

item.title: Trump Says US Will Have ‘Golden Share’ in US Steel
item.description: President Donald Trump says the US government will retain a “golden share” in United States Steel after its purchase by Japan’s Nippon Steel.

item.title: Trump Calls California’s EV Mandate a ‘Disaster’
item.description: President Donald Trump signed mandates that revoke California clean air policies, including requirements that carmakers sell electric vehicles in greater numbers each year in the state.

item.title: Tesla Sues Ex-Optimus Engineer Alleging Theft of Robotic Trade Secrets
item.description: Tesla Inc. sued a former engineer with the company’s highly secretive Optimus program, accusing him of stealing confidential information about the humanoid robot and setting up a rival startup in Silicon Valley.
item.dc:creator: Dana Hull

media:content.media:description: A Tesla Inc. Optimus robot at the Paris Motor Show in Paris, on Oct. 15.

item.title: UK Pension Intervention Will Unlock Capital, Tech Minister Says
item.description: The London Stock Exchange is under-capitalized and the UK government’s plan to intervene in pension funds — forcing them to invest in private companies — will boost the amount of money being pumped into the economy, Technology Secretary Peter Kyle said.
item.dc:creator: Jillian Deutsch, Lizzy Burden

media:content.media:description: The London Stock Exchange Group Plc headquarters in Paternoster Square in the City of London, UK, on Thursday, Jan. 9, 2025. The pound dropped to a more than one-year low, stocks fell and gilts extended a fourth day of losses on concern the Labour government will struggle to keep the deficit in check as borrowing costs surge.

item.title: Arm CEO Sides With Nvidia on US Export Limits on China
item.description: Arm Holdings Plc CEO Rene Haas aligned himself with Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang in saying that US export controls on China threaten to slow overall technological advances and are ultimately bad for consumers and companies. Haas spoke Thursday in an interview with Bloomberg at the Founders Forum Global conference in Oxford.

item.title: Synthesia CEO Riparbelli on Tech Opportunities in Europe
item.description: Synthesia CEO Victor Riparbelli says ongoing political tension has created better opportunities for entrepreneurs to build companies as focus shifts away from regulation and into the technology and defense sectors. He speaks with Bloomberg's Tom Mackenzie at the Founders Forum in Oxfordshire. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Why Voyager Shares Are Jumping After Upsized IPO
item.description: Voyager Technologies shares ended their debut trading day up 82% after the company raised $383 million in an upsized US initial public offering. Norah Mulinda reports on “Bloomberg Open Interest.”

item.title: Micron Pledges $200 Billion Investment in US Manufacturing
item.description: Chipmaker Micron Technology Inc. said it will spend about $200 billion on US manufacturing, research and development, the latest company to pledge large-scale investments in the country since President Donald Trump won election.
item.dc:creator: Dana Wollman

item.title: Micron to Invest About $200B in US Chip Manufacturing
item.description: Micron Technology said it will spend about $200 billion on US manufacturing, research and development. The spending will include roughly $150 billion for domestic manufacturing capacity and another $50 billion for R&D. Jake Silverman has more on “Bloomberg The Open.”
